str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
